problem.markdown: Let X be a normal random variable with mean 9 and variance 16. Use the normal table (see here) to find the following probabilities, to an accuracy of 4 decimal places. a. \(P(X \le 10.6) \) = ____ ===== = 0.6554 +- 5% [explanation] \(P(X \le 10.6) = P((X-9)/4 \le (10.6 - 9)/4) = \phi(0.4) = 0.6554 \) [explanation] b. \(P(X \ge 7.4) \) = ____ ===== = 0.6554 +- 5% [explanation] \(P(X \ge 7.4) = P(X \le 10.6) \) by symmetry \(P(X \le 10.6) = P((X-9)/4 \le (10.6 - 9)/4) = \phi(0.4) = 0.6554 \) [explanation] c. \(P(X \le 6.6) \) = ____ ===== = 0.2743 +- 5% [explanation] \(P(X \le 6.6) = P((X-9)/4 \le (6.6 - 9)/4) = 1 - \phi(0.6) = 1 - 0.72575 = 0.2743 \) [explanation]
